alert.note: Alert for King George; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 01 at 8:49PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and northern Virginia, including the following counties: in central Virginia, King George. In northern Virginia, Stafford. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 847 PM EDT, Local law enforcement reported flooding in multiple areas along Kings Highway and Rt. 3 due to thunderstorms. Between 3.5 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen. No additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... King George... Fairview Beach... Passapatanzy... Dogue... Lambs Creek... Weedonville... Jersey... Sealston... Shiloh... - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
